item.title: England and Tottenham legend Greaves dies aged 81
item.description: World Cup-winning England striker and Tottenham's record goalscorer Jimmy Greaves dies at the age of 81.

item.title: Gas price rise: 'UK not seeing risks to supplies right now'
item.description: COP26 president Alok Sharma says people should not be concerned about prices hikes or supply shortages.

item.title: Gas prices: Are energy bills going up and what can I do?
item.description: Gas prices have soared by 250% since January but what does that mean for household bills?

item.title: Aukus: Truss defends security deal amid criticism
item.description: The deal will make the UK safer and could create hundreds of jobs, the new foreign secretary says.

item.title: History-making space tourists splash down to Earth
item.description: The four amateur astronauts landed safely in the Atlantic Ocean after three days orbiting Earth.

item.title: Get an Eiffel of this performer walking the line in Paris
item.description: Nathan Paulin walks along a 70m (230ft) high slackline attached to an iconic French landmark.

item.title: Lib Dems: Give parents Covid catch-up vouchers to spend
item.description: Sir Ed Davey will use his conference speech to call for a fairer deal for carers, parents and business.

item.title: Police outnumber protesters at right-wing Capitol rally
item.description: A rally in support of jailed rioters draws a few hundred attendees - and more press and police.

item.title: Johannesburg mayor Jolidee Matongo killed in car crash
item.description: South Africa's President Ramaphosa pays tribute to Jolidee Matongo, who died at the age of 46.

item.title: Boris Johnson to call for climate action during US visit
item.description: Boris Johnson will also visit the White House for the first time since Joe Biden became US president.

item.title: Migrants in Texas: Thousands moved to processing centres
item.description: More than 10,000 people have gathered under a bridge in Del Rio, a Texas border town.

item.title: Boxer Amir Khan removed from US flight
item.description: The Briton was asked to leave the plane at Newark airport after a reported row over face coverings.

item.title: Liam Gallagher shares photo after 'helicopter fall'
item.description: The former Oasis frontman shares an image of his bruised face after playing the Isle of Wight Festival.

item.title: Afghanistan: The 'shattered dreams' of the Ariana cabin crew
item.description: The BBC's Lyse Doucet meets the female crew of Afghanistan's national airline, who are in hiding.

item.title: Sickle cell: 'Did our son have to die to change things?'
item.description: It's the fastest-growing genetic condition in the UK but some feel the illness, which mostly affects black people, isn't taken seriously.

item.title: Jimmy Greaves: Watch great goals of Tottenham, Chelsea, West Ham & England striker
item.description: BBC Sport looks back at some great goals from Jimmy Greaves' career and highlights the statistics that made him a footballing legend.

item.title: Strictly champ Oti Mabuse goes for hat-trick with rugby star Ugo Monye
item.description: Oti Mabuse and Ugo Monye's rivals include the show's first all-male pair - John Whaite and Johannes Radebe.

item.title: Isle of Wight Festival: Courtney Cox among stars spotted in photos
item.description: Pictures from the Isle of Wight Festival show star names performing and soaking up the atmosphere.

item.title: Morgan Bullock makes professional debut in Riverdance
item.description: Morgan Bullock from Richmond, Virginia, joins the UK touring company of the acclaimed Irish dance show.

item.title: The link between climate change, seaweed and ice cream
item.description: Seaweed production has been affected by warming seas – this is how farmers are adapting.

item.title: Baby squirrel abandoned on Cambridge patio bonds with carer
item.description: The squirrel, named Paquito, formed an unexpected friendship with his temporary carer.

item.title: Week in pictures: 11 - 17 September 2021
item.description: A selection of powerful images from all over the globe, taken this week.

item.title: Ros Atkins On… the ethics of Covid booster jabs
item.description: Ros Atkins looks at the ethics of Western countries rolling out Covid booster jabs while millions globally remain unvaccinated.

item.title: 'Dachshund disco is a children's party for your dog'
item.description: Organisers James Morgan and Anushka Fernando want to help dogs socialise again after lockdown.

item.title: Everybody's Talking About Jamie: Sheffield welcomes home coming-of-age story
item.description: Jamie Campbell salutes Sheffield's role in the story of his extraordinary life.

item.title: Afghanistan: The escape of the whirling dancer
item.description: How the only female whirling dancer in Afghanistan made it out of Kabul.

item.title: Nadine Dorries: Best-selling author, nurse, reality star and, now, cabinet minister
item.description: Mistrusted by some in the arts, the new culture secretary is said by a colleague to be "up for the fight".

item.title: Emmy Awards: 7 things to know ahead of the ceremony
item.description: That's one possibility at this year's event, where Ted Lasso and The Crown are among other nominees.

item.title: Turkmenistan: Getting Covid in a land where no cases officially exist
item.description: People in Turkmenistan are struggling to get treatment in a system that denies there are any cases.

item.title: Fake Paralympians boss: 'I didn't know about cheating'
item.description: The man fined for sending non-disabled athletes to the Sydney Paralympics breaks his silence.

item.title: Should schools retain online parents' evenings?
item.description: Parents and teachers seem to agree it is the number one innovation worth keeping post-lockdown.

item.title: Canada election: Why it’s easier to vote in Canada than the US
item.description: Things like advanced voting and federally-run elections make it easier for Canadians to vote.

item.title: Strictly Come Dancing: 15 things we learned from the stars of 2021
item.description: A round-up of 15 things we learned from this year's Strictly Come Dancing celebrities.

item.title: Climate change: Should green campaigners put more pressure on China to slash emissions?
item.description: UK activists have protested on the M25, but should they instead be picketing China's embassy?

item.title: 'There’s security but no money': Afghans settle into life under Taliban rule
item.description: In Mazar-i-Sharif, former army pilots are flying Taliban around and families are selling possessions for food.

item.title: Unpaid state pension: 'I'm disgusted by delays'
item.description: Thousands of people who have turned 66 have not been paid their state pensions and they are furious.

item.title: Lib Dem conference: Sir Ed Davey gambles on targeting Tories
item.description: The Lib Dems are facing a battle to get heard at their online conference but they are in good spirits.

item.title: German elections: How Angela Merkel changed her country
item.description: Young people have never known another leader, and many worry for the future as old certainties shift.

item.title: Sherrock makes history by reaching final before losing to Van Gerwen
item.description: Fallon Sherrock becomes the first woman to reach a televised PDC final, but loses to Michael van Gerwen at the Nordic Darts Masters.

item.title: Davis wins at Bellator 266 - but Romero expected five rounds not three
item.description: Former light heavyweight champion Phil Davis spoils Yoel Romero's debut in the main event of Bellator 266 with a split-decision win.

item.title: Guardiola feels 'guilty' after Southampton stalemate
item.description: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola says he feels "guilty" after his side fail to put on "a show" in Saturday's goalless draw with Southampton.

item.title: Former pro cyclist Sorensen dies after being hit by vehicle
item.description: Danish former professional cyclist Chris Anker Sorensen dies at the age of 37 after being hit by a vehicle during a ride in Belgium, the International Cycling Union (UCI) says.

item.title: What are the travel rules now and for half term?
item.description: The rules on foreign travel to and from England are being simplified.

item.title: What are the travel rules for Spain, Portugal, Malta and other holiday hotspots?
item.description: What you need to know about going to Portugal, Spain, Greece, France, Malta, Italy and Turkey.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Covid rules: What's in England's 'Winter Plan'?
item.description: Lockdown rules have changed across the UK, but some restrictions remain in place.

item.title: Covid: Will I need a jab and what will university be like this term?
item.description: Many Covid restrictions have been lifted for students going to university this term.

item.title: Covid: People are vaccinated - so why are there so many cases?
item.description: More than four out of five UK adults are now fully vaccinated, but daily case rates remain high.

item.title: Covid vaccines: How fast is progress around the world?
item.description: Charts and maps tracking the progress of Covid vaccination programmes.

item.title: Covid passports: How do I get one and when will I need it?
item.description: People in Scotland will need to be fully vaccinated to go to clubs, sporting events and concerts.

item.title: Long Covid: What is it and what are the symptoms?
item.description: Significant numbers have had long-term problems after recovering from the original infection.

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings?
item.description: Face coverings could become a legal requirement in England again if the NHS struggles this winter.

item.title: Flu jab 2021: Who’s eligible for a free vaccine?
item.description: This year's roll out has expanded in an attempt to shield against a double whammy of flu and Covid.

item.title: Is it safe to vaccinate our child? And other questions
item.description: We answer some of your questions about vaccinating 12-15 year-olds, the booster vaccine and other topics.

item.title: Hushpuppi - the Instagram influencer and international fraudster
item.description: How Nigerian Ramon Abbas went from a romance scammer to a so-called "Billionaire Gucci Master".

item.title: ‘Havana syndrome ’ and the mystery of the microwaves
item.description: The BBC investigates a mystery illness dubbed "Havana syndrome" that has affected American diplomats and spies.

item.title: 'The near-death experience that made me a top musician'
item.description: When Tony Kofi had a near-fatal accident, he had a vision of himself playing a musical instrument. It would change his life forever.

item.title: Chaos and confusion: The frenzied final hours of the Afghan government
item.description: Through interviews with insiders, BBC News has pieced together an account of how Afghanistan’s government unravelled.

item.title: 'I studied law in jail - now I want to change the system'
item.description: LaTonya Myers spent nine months in jail because she couldn’t afford bail - now she's helping others facing the same challenge.
